text: In which hotel are you staying?
How long have you been here for?
translate: 당신은 여기 온 지 얼마나 됐어요?
translit: dangsin-eun yeogi on ji eolmana dwaess-eoyo?

text: How long will you be staying?
Shall we see each other tomorrow?
I am sorry, but I already have plans.
He is here and she is here.
translate: 그는 여기 있고 그녀는 여기 있어요.
translit: geuneun yeogi issgo geunyeoneun yeogi iss-eoyo.

text: We are having class / a lesson.
We want to speak with people.
I was at the cinema yesterday.
We only work for five days.
Do you drink tea with lemon?
Do you drink coffee with sugar?
Do you drink water with ice?
People are drinking wine and beer.
Do you drink Coke with rum?
The child likes cocoa and apple juice.
The woman likes orange and grapefruit juice.
I have a kiwi and a melon.
I have an orange and a grapefruit.
I have an apple and a mango.
I have a banana and a pineapple.
I am making a fruit salad.
I am eating toast with butter.
translate: 저는 버터를 바른 토스트를 먹고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun beoteoleul baleun toseuteuleul meoggo iss-eoyo.

text: I am eating toast with butter and jam.
translate: 저는 버터와 잼을 바른 토스트를 먹고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun beoteowa jaem-eul baleun toseuteuleul meoggo iss-eoyo.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine.
translate: 저는 마가린을 바른 샌드위치를 먹고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun magalin-eul baleun saendeuwichileul meoggo iss-eoyo.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine and tomatoes.
translate: 저는 마가린과 토마토를 넣은 샌드위치를 먹고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun magalingwa tomatoleul neoh-eun saendeuwichileul meoggo iss-eoyo.

text: We need carrots and tomatoes for the soup.
translate: 우리는 수프에 넣을 당근과 토마토가 필요해요.
translit: ulineun supeue neoh-eul dang-geungwa tomatoga pil-yohaeyo.

text: Peter and Martha are from Berlin.
Do both of you speak German?
Madrid and Berlin are also capital cities.
Capital cities are big and noisy.
Where do they like to go?
They like to listen to music.
Where do they not like to go?
translate: 그들은 어디 가는 것을 안 좋아해요?
translit: geudeul-eun eodi ganeun geos-eul an joh-ahaeyo?

text: They do not like to dance.
Do you have a new kitchen?
What do you want to cook today?
Do you cook on an electric or a gas stove?
translate: 당신은 전기로 요리해요, 아니면 가스로 요리해요?
translit: dangsin-eun jeongilo yolihaeyo, animyeon gaseulo yolihaeyo?

text: Do you have a tin opener / can opener (am.)?
Do you have a bottle opener?
Are you cooking the soup in this pot?
translate: 당신은 수프를 이 솥에 요리하고 있어요?
translit: dangsin-eun supeuleul i sot-e yolihago iss-eoyo?

text: Are you frying the fish in this pan?
translate: 당신은 생선을 이 팬에 굽고 있어요?
translit: dangsin-eun saengseon-eul i paen-e gubgo iss-eoyo?

text: Are you grilling the vegetables on this grill?
translate: 당신은 채소를 이 그릴에 굽고 있어요?
translit: dangsin-eun chaesoleul i geulil-e gubgo iss-eoyo?

text: Here are the knives, the forks and the spoons.
Here are the glasses, the plates and the napkins.
We like to go for a walk in summer.
It snows or rains in winter.
We like to stay home in winter.
translate: 우리는 겨울에 집에 있는 것을 좋아해요.
translit: ulineun gyeoul-e jib-e issneun geos-eul joh-ahaeyo.

text: What is the weather like today?
There is a garden behind the house.
There is no street in front of the house.
There are trees next to the house.
The kitchen and bathroom are here.
The living room and bedroom are there.
We are going to the living room.
There is a sofa and an armchair there.
The TV set is brand new.
We are cleaning the apartment today.
My husband is washing the car.
The children are cleaning the bicycles.
The children are cleaning up the children’s room.
My husband is tidying up his desk.
translate: 제 남편은 자기의 책상을 정리하고 있어요.
translit: je nampyeon-eun jagiui chaegsang-eul jeonglihago iss-eoyo.

text: I am putting the laundry in the washing machine.
I am hanging up the laundry.
What would you like to drink?
Do you play a musical instrument?
I am currently reading this book.
translate: 저는 지금 이 책을 읽고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun jigeum i chaeg-eul ilg-go iss-eoyo.

text: What do you like to read?
Do you like to go to concerts?
Do you like to go to the theatre / theater (am.)?
Do you like to go to the opera?
Do you see the tower there?
Do you see the mountain there?
Do you see the village there?
Do you see the river there?
Do you see the bridge there?
Do you see the lake there?
What colour / color (am.) is the snow? White.
What colour / color (am.) is the sun? Yellow.
What colour / color (am.) is the orange? Orange.
What colour / color (am.) is the cherry? Red.
What colour / color (am.) is the sky? Blue.
What colour / color (am.) is the grass? Green.
What colour / color (am.) is the earth? Brown.
What colour / color (am.) is the cloud? Grey / Gray (am.).
What colour / color (am.) are the tyres / tires (am.)? Black.
Are you here for the first time?
No, I was here once last year.
How do you like it here?
A lot. The people are nice.
And I like the scenery, too.
No, my wife / my husband is also here.
And those are my two children.
There is no telephone in the room.
There is no TV in the room.
Is there a youth hostel nearby?
Is there a boarding house / a bed and breakfast nearby?
I would like to go to the station.
I would like to go to the airport.
I would like to go to the city centre / center (am.).
How do I get to the station?
How do I get to the airport?
How do I get to the city centre / center (am.)?
I would like to rent a car.
What is there to see in the city?
Go on a harbour / harbor (am.) tour.
Are there any other places of interest?
Yes, and I also speak some Italian.
I think you speak very well.

translate: 저는 그것들을 잘 알아들을 수 있어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeosdeul-eul jal al-adeul-eul su iss-eoyo.

text: But speaking and writing is difficult.
You only have a slight accent.
One can tell where you come from.
translate: 당신이 어디서 왔는지 알아볼 수 있어요.
translit: dangsin-i eodiseo wassneunji al-abol su iss-eoyo.

text: What is your mother tongue / native language (am.)?
Are you taking a language course?
I don’t remember the name right now.
translate: 지금 당장은 그 이름이 기억 안 나요.
translit: jigeum dangjang-eun geu ileum-i gieog an nayo.

text: The title is not coming to me.

translate: 하지만 지금은 더 이상 안 피워요.
translit: hajiman jigeum-eun deo isang an piwoyo.

text: Does it disturb you if I smoke?
I’d like a glass of red wine.
I’d like a glass of white wine.
I’d like a bottle of champagne.
I’d like something that won’t take much time.
Would you like that with rice?
Would you like that with pasta?
Would you like that with potatoes?
I waited for you for half an hour.
Don’t you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
Take an umbrella with you next time!
I have the day off tomorrow.
I’m sorry, I can’t make it tomorrow.
Do you already have plans for this weekend?
Or do you already have an appointment?
I suggest that we meet on the weekend.
Shall we go to the beach?
Shall we go to the mountains?
I will pick you up at the office.
I will pick you up at home.
I will pick you up at the bus stop.
I’d like chips / French fries (am.) with ketchup.

translate: 그리고 소시지 세 개는 겨자하고 주세요.
translit: geuligo sosiji se gaeneun gyeojahago juseyo.

text: Do you also like to eat leek?
Do you also like to eat sauerkraut?
Do you also like to eat lentils?
Do you also like to eat carrots?
Do you also like to eat broccoli?
Do you also like to eat peppers?
Do you have a vacant room?
What does the room cost per night?
I would like a room with a bathroom.
I would like a room with a shower.
When is the next train to Berlin?
When is the next train to Paris?
When is the next train to London?
Is there a fax machine here?
What time do you serve breakfast?
What time do you serve lunch?
What time do you serve dinner?
When does the train for Warsaw leave?
When does the train for Stockholm leave?
When does the train for Budapest leave?
I’d like to book a flight to Athens.
I’d like a ticket to Madrid.
I’d like a ticket to Prague.
I’d like a ticket to Bern.
When does the train arrive in Vienna?
When does the train arrive in Moscow?
When does the train arrive in Amsterdam?
Do I have to change trains?
From which platform does the train leave?
I’d like a one-way ticket to Brussels.
translate: 브뤼셀행 편도 표를 한 장 주세요.
translit: beulwiselhaeng pyeondo pyoleul han jang juseyo.

text: Is that the train to Berlin?
I would like to confirm my reservation.
I would like to cancel my reservation.
I would like to change my reservation.
When is the next flight to Rome?
I’d like a return ticket to Copenhagen.
translate: 코펜하겐으로 돌아가는 표를 한 장 주세요.
translit: kopenhagen-eulo dol-aganeun pyoleul han jang juseyo.

text: What does a berth in the sleeper cost?
When does the train arrive in Berlin?
I think this is my seat.
I think you’re sitting in my seat.
translate: 당신이 제 자리에 앉아 있은 것 같아요.
translit: dangsin-i je jalie anj-a iss-eun geos gat-ayo.

text: No, we have only one seat available.
When does a bus go to the city centre / center (am.)?
The sleeper is at the end of the train.
And where is the dining car? – At the front.
Can I sleep in the middle?
Can I sleep at the top?
When will we get to the border?
How much luggage can I take?
translate: 얼마나 많은 짐을 가져갈 수 있어요?
translit: eolmana manh-eun jim-eul gajyeogal su iss-eoyo?

text: How long does the journey to Berlin take?
Do you have something to read?
Can one get something to eat and to drink here?
translate: 여기서 먹을 것과 마실 것을 살 수 있어요?
translit: yeogiseo meog-eul geosgwa masil geos-eul sal su iss-eoyo?

text: Could you please wake me up at 7 o’clock?
I would like the menu, please.
I’d like a coffee with milk.
I’d like a tea with lemon.
I’d like a tea with milk.
Which bus goes to the city centre / center (am.)?
Which bus do I have to take?
Where do I have to change?
How much does a ticket cost?
How many stops are there before downtown / the city centre?
You have to get off here.
You have to get off at the back.
The next train is in 5 minutes.
translate: 다음 기차는 오 분 후에 와요.
translit: da-eum gichaneun o bun hue wayo.

text: The next tram is in 10 minutes.
translate: 다음 전철은 십 분 후에 와요.
translit: da-eum jeoncheol-eun sib bun hue wayo.

text: The next bus is in 15 minutes.
translate: 다음 버스는 십오 분 후에 와요.
translit: da-eum beoseuneun sib-o bun hue wayo.

text: Is it dangerous to hitchhike alone?
Is it dangerous to go for a walk at night?
A ticket? – No, I don’t have one.
Then you have to pay a fine.
Is there a parking lot here?
How long can one park here?
translate: 여기서 얼마나 오래 주차할 수 있어요?
translit: yeogiseo eolmana olae juchahal su iss-eoyo?

text: Do you take the ski lift to the top?
I would like an ice cream with whipped cream.
I would like some fruit or cheese.
We would like to have breakfast.
We would like to have lunch.
We would like to have dinner.
What would you like for breakfast?
Some salt and pepper also, please.
I also have a video camera.
Where can I find a battery?
There is a café over there.
There is a restaurant over there.

Where are the tigers and the crocodiles?
Is the market open on Sundays?
Is the fair open on Mondays?

Is the zoo open on Wednesdays?

How much is the entrance fee?

Is there a discount for children?
Is there a discount for students?

But the band plays very well.
No, this is the first time.
Is there a good restaurant around here?
Take a left at the corner.
Then go straight for a while.
Then go right for a hundred metres / meters (am.).
translate: 그런 다음 오른쪽으로 백 미터 가세요.
translit: geuleon da-eum oleunjjog-eulo baeg miteo gaseyo.

text: You can also take the bus.
You can also take the tram.
You can also follow me with your car.
How do I get to the football / soccer (am.) stadium?
Drive until you reach the third traffic light.
translate: 세 번째 신호등이 나올 때까지 가세요.
translit: se beonjjae sinhodeung-i naol ttaekkaji gaseyo.

text: Then turn into the first street on your right.
translate: 그런 다음 오른쪽에 처음 길로 들어가세요.
translit: geuleon da-eum oleunjjog-e cheoeum gillo deul-eogaseyo.

text: Then drive straight through the next intersection.
translate: 그런 다음 직진해서 다음 사거리를 지나세요.
translit: geuleon da-eum jigjinhaeseo da-eum sageolileul jinaseyo.

text: Excuse me, how do I get to the airport?
It is best if you take the underground / subway (am.).
Simply get out at the last stop.
What does it cost to go to the station?
What does it cost to go to the airport?
Please turn left at the corner.
You have to pack our suitcase!
That is okay, please keep the change.
Don’t forget your traveller’s cheques / traveler’s checks (am.)!
Take some suntan lotion with you.
Take the sun hat with you.
Do you want to take a road map?
Do you want to take a travel guide?
Do you want to take an umbrella?
Remember to take pants, shirts and socks.
translate: 바지와, 셔츠와, 양말을 꼭 가져 가세요.
translit: bajiwa, syeocheuwa, yangmal-eul kkog gajyeo gaseyo.

text: Remember to take ties, belts and sports jackets.
translate: 넥타이와, 벨트와, 자켓을 꼭 가져 가세요.
translit: negtaiwa, belteuwa, jakes-eul kkog gajyeo gaseyo.

text: Remember to take pyjamas, nightgowns and t-shirts.
translate: 잠옷과, 나이트 가운과, 티셔츠를 꼭 가져 가세요.
translit: jam-osgwa, naiteu gaungwa, tisyeocheuleul kkog gajyeo gaseyo.

text: You need shoes, sandals and boots.
You need handkerchiefs, soap and a nail clipper.
You need a comb, a toothbrush and toothpaste.
Shall we go to the swimming pool?
Do you have a bathing suit?
Can you jump in the water?
I am getting out of the water now.
What’s playing at the theatre / theater (am.) this evening?
translate: 오늘 저녁에 극장에서 무슨 공연을 해요?
translit: oneul jeonyeog-e geugjang-eseo museun gong-yeon-eul haeyo?

text: What’s playing at the cinema / movies (am.) this evening?
Are tickets for the theatre / theater (am.) still available?
Are tickets for the cinema / movies (am.) still available?
Are tickets for the football / soccer am. game still available?
I want to sit in the back.
I want to sit somewhere in the middle.
I want to sit at the front.

A good film is playing today.

Do you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
I want to sit at the back.
I want to sit at the front.
I want to sit in the middle.
But the book on which the film was based was better.
translate: 하지만 영화의 원작인 책이 더 좋았어요.
translit: hajiman yeonghwaui wonjag-in chaeg-i deo joh-ass-eoyo.

text: We’re looking for a sports shop.
Isn’t it dangerous to swim there?
Can one rent a sun umbrella / parasol here?
Can one rent a deck chair here?
translate: 여기서 일광욕 의자를 빌릴 수 있어요?
translit: yeogiseo ilgwang-yog uijaleul billil su iss-eoyo?

text: Can one rent a boat here?
We’re looking for a butcher shop.
We’re looking for a pharmacy / drugstore (am.).
We want to buy a football.
We’re looking for a sports shop to buy a football.
translate: 우리는 축구공을 사려고 스포츠용품 가게를 찾고 있어요.
translit: ulineun chuggugong-eul salyeogo seupocheuyongpum gageleul chajgo iss-eoyo.

text: We’re looking for a butcher shop to buy salami.
translate: 우리는 살라미 햄을 사려고 정육점을 찾고 있어요.
translit: ulineun sallami haem-eul salyeogo jeong-yugjeom-eul chajgo iss-eoyo.

text: We’re looking for a drugstore to buy medicine.
translate: 우리는 약을 사려고 약국을 찾고 있어요.
translit: ulineun yag-eul salyeogo yaggug-eul chajgo iss-eoyo.

text: I am a member of a sports club.
I would like to water ski.
I’m looking for a jeweller / jeweler (am.).
I’m looking for a photo equipment store.
translate: 저는 사진 장비 가게를 찾고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun sajin jangbi gageleul chajgo iss-eoyo.

text: I actually plan to buy a ring.
I actually plan to buy a roll of film.
I actually plan to buy a cake.
I’m looking for a jeweler to buy a ring.
translate: 저는 반지를 사기 위해 보석가게를 찾고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun banjileul sagi wihae boseoggageleul chajgo iss-eoyo.

text: I’m looking for a photo shop to buy a roll of film.
translate: 저는 필름을 사기 위해 사진관을 찾고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun pilleum-eul sagi wihae sajingwan-eul chajgo iss-eoyo.

text: There is a football / soccer (am.) stadium in our city.
There is also a swimming pool with a sauna.
And there is a golf course.
I’m looking for a confectionery to buy a cake.
translate: 저는 케이크를 사기 위해 제과점을 찾고 있어요.
translit: jeoneun keikeuleul sagi wihae jegwajeom-eul chajgo iss-eoyo.

text: Where is the tourist information office?
There is a football / soccer (am.) match on now.
The German team is playing against the English one.
translate: 독일 팀이 영국 팀과 경기하고 있어요.
translit: dog-il tim-i yeong-gug timgwa gyeong-gihago iss-eoyo.

text: Do you have a city map for me?
Can one reserve a room here?

I would like a guide who speaks Italian.

translit: syupeomakes-e gaseo gwailgwa yachaeleul sago sip-eoyo.

I work as a nurse part-time.
We will soon receive our pension.

I want to go to college.

translit: jeoneun sil-eobjaga doen ji imi il nyeon dwaess-eoyo.

text: There are too many unemployed people in this country.
I would like to open an account.
I want to deposit money in my account.
I want to withdraw money from my account.
I want to pick up the bank statements.

I’m expecting a transfer from Germany.

How much money can one withdraw?
Which credit cards can one use?
The man is wearing a hat.
One cannot see the ears either.
One cannot see his back either.
I am drawing the eyes and the mouth.
The man is dancing and laughing.
The man has a long nose.
He is carrying a cane in his hands.
He is also wearing a scarf around his neck.
translate: 그는 또한 목에 목도리를 두르고 있어요.
translit: geuneun ttohan mog-e mogdolileul duleugo iss-eoyo.

text: It is winter and it is cold.
The man is made of snow.
He is neither wearing pants nor a coat.
translate: 그는 바지도, 외투도 입지 않고 있어요.
translit: geuneun bajido, oetudo ibji anhgo iss-eoyo.

text: But the man is not freezing.
I want to buy a present.
A large one or a small one?
May I see this one, please?
Or is it made of plastic?
And the bag is really very reasonable.
Can I exchange it if needed?

For a card and a letter.

The doctor is on his way.

Lie down on the examining table.
I will give you an injection.
I will give you some pills.
I am giving you a prescription for the pharmacy.

No, I don’t ask him questions often.
Yes, he is working right now.

translate: 저는 그 단어를 이해 못 해요.
translit: jeoneun geu dan-eoleul ihae mos haeyo.

translate: 저는 그 문장을 이해 못 해요.
translit: jeoneun geu munjang-eul ihae mos haeyo.

translate: 저는 그 뜻을 이해 못 해요.
translit: jeoneun geu tteus-eul ihae mos haeyo.

text: We feel like. / We want to.
We don’t feel like. / We do’t want to.
No, I don’t understand them so well.
Six months make half a year.

translate: 그는 그의 안경을 안 가지고 왔어요.
translit: geuneun geuui angyeong-eul an gajigo wass-eoyo.

text: Where has he left his glasses?
The clock hangs on the wall.
The children cannot find their parents.
How was your trip, Mr. Miller?
Where is your wife, Mr. Miller?
translate: 당신의 아내는 어디 있어요, 뮐러 씨?
translit: dangsin-ui anaeneun eodi iss-eoyo, mwilleo ssi?

text: How was your trip, Mrs. Smith?
Where is your husband, Mrs. Smith?
translate: 당신의 남편은 어디 있어요, 스미스 양?
translit: dangsin-ui nampyeon-eun eodi iss-eoyo, seumiseu yang?

text: Where is the football / soccer (am.) field?
My foot and hand also hurt.
I have a car / an automobile.
I also have a jacket and a pair of jeans.
I have a knife, a fork and a spoon.
Where is the salt and pepper?
Are you already allowed to drive?
Are you already allowed to drink alcohol?
Are you already allowed to travel abroad alone?
translate: 당신은 벌써 혼자 외국 여행을 해도 돼요?
translit: dangsin-eun beolsseo honja oegug yeohaeng-eul haedo dwaeyo?

text: May one pay by credit card?
May one pay by cheque / check (am.)?
May one only pay in cash?
May I just make a call?
He is not allowed to sleep in the park.
He is not allowed to sleep in the car.
translate: 그는 차 안에서 자면 안 돼요.
translit: geuneun cha an-eseo jamyeon an dwaeyo.

text: He is not allowed to sleep at the train station.
I want to make a call.
I want to send an email.
Is there a sheet of paper and a pen here?
Would you like to go for a walk?
I want to relax a little.
I want to ask you something.
I want to ask you for something.
I want to treat you to something.
Or do you prefer a tea?
They want to make a call.
70 years ago he was still young.
translate: 칠십 년 전에 그는 아직 젊었어요.
translit: chilsib nyeon jeon-e geuneun ajig jeolm-eoss-eoyo.

text: A woman who weighs a hundred kilos is fat.
A man who weighs fifty kilos is thin.
What do you want to do?
Do you want to play football / soccer (am.)?
Do you want to visit friends?
I don’t want to arrive late.
translate: 저는 늦게 도착하는 것을 원하지 않아요.
translit: jeoneun neujge dochaghaneun geos-eul wonhaji anh-ayo.

text: I don’t want to go there.
translate: 저는 거기 가는 것을 원하지 않아요.
translit: jeoneun geogi ganeun geos-eul wonhaji anh-ayo.

text: I want to stay at home.
Do you want to stay here?
Do you want to eat here?
Do you want to sleep here?
Do you want to leave tomorrow?
Do you want to stay till tomorrow?
Do you want to pay the bill only tomorrow?
Do you want to go to the disco?
Do you want to go to the cinema?
Do you want to go to a café?

chapter: to have to do something / must
to have to do something / must
to have to do something / must

to have to do something / must

to have to do something / must
text: He must fuel / get petrol / get gas (am.).

chapter: to have to do something / must
to have to do something / must
to have to do something / must

to have to do something / must
to have to do something / must
text: We must go to school at once.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: We must go to work at once.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: We must go to the doctor at once.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the bus.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the train.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the taxi.
I didn’t come because I was ill.
She didn’t come because she was tired.
He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
We didn’t come because our car is damaged.
They didn’t come because they missed the train.
I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
translate: 저는 허락을 못 받아서 안 왔어요.
translit: jeoneun heolag-eul mos bad-aseo an wass-eoyo.

text: The pictures are on the CD.
The pictures are in the camera.
Can you clean the pants / trousers?
Do you have a match or a lighter?
He is staying in a hotel.
He is staying in a cheap hotel.
He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
Did you have to call an ambulance?
Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?
Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.
translate: 그 전화번호가 있어요? 방금 전에 있었어요.
translit: geu jeonhwabeonhoga iss-eoyo? bang-geum jeon-e iss-eoss-eoyo.

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: 그 주소가 있어요? 방금 전에 있었어요.
translit: geu jusoga iss-eoyo? bang-geum jeon-e iss-eoss-eoyo.

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.
translate: 그 도시 지도가 있어요? 방금 전에 있었어요.
translit: geu dosi jidoga iss-eoyo? bang-geum jeon-e iss-eoss-eoyo.

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: 그가 정각에 왔어요? 그는 정각에 못 왔어요.
translit: geuga jeong-gag-e wass-eoyo? geuneun jeong-gag-e mos wass-eoyo.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: 그가 길을 찾았어요? 그는 길을 못 찾았어요.
translit: geuga gil-eul chaj-ass-eoyo? geuneun gil-eul mos chaj-ass-eoyo.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
translate: 그가 당신을 이해했어요? 그는 저를 이해 못했어요.
translit: geuga dangsin-eul ihaehaess-eoyo? geuneun jeoleul ihae moshaess-eoyo.

text: Why could you not come on time?
Why could you not find the way?
Why could you not understand him?
I could not come on time because there were no buses.
I could not find the way because I had no city map.
translate: 도시 지도가 없어서 길을 못 찾았어요.
translit: dosi jidoga eobs-eoseo gil-eul mos chaj-ass-eoyo.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.
translate: 음악이 너무 시끄러워서 그를 이해 못 했어요.
translit: eum-ag-i neomu sikkeuleowoseo geuleul ihae mos haess-eoyo.

text: I had to take a taxi.
I had to buy a city map.
I had to switch off the radio.
Why aren’t you eating the cake?
I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
translate: 저는 살을 빼야 해서 안 먹어요.
translit: jeoneun sal-eul ppaeya haeseo an meog-eoyo.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?
I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
translate: 저는 운전을 해야 해서 안 마셔요.
translit: jeoneun unjeon-eul haeya haeseo an masyeoyo.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
Why aren’t you eating the soup?
Do you know where his key is?
Do you know where his ticket is?
I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
translate: 저는 그걸 주문하지 않아서 안 먹어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol jumunhaji anh-aseo an meog-eoyo.

text: Why don’t you eat the meat?
And her credit card is also gone.
I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.
She took a piece of chocolate.
I know that – I knew that.
translate: 저는 그걸 알아요 – 저는 그걸 알았어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol al-ayo – jeoneun geugeol al-ass-eoyo.

text: I write that – I wrote that.
translate: 저는 그걸 써요 – 저는 그걸 썼어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol sseoyo – jeoneun geugeol sseoss-eoyo.

text: I hear that – I heard that.
translate: 저는 그걸 들어요 – 저는 그걸 들었어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol deul-eoyo – jeoneun geugeol deul-eoss-eoyo.

text: I am not coming because the weather is so bad.
translate: 저는 날씨가 너무 나빠서 안 가요.
translit: jeoneun nalssiga neomu nappaseo an gayo.

text: He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.
translate: 그는 초대 받지 않아서 안 와요.
translit: geuneun chodae badji anh-aseo an wayo.

text: I am not coming because I have no time.
He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
translate: 그는 의리가 없었지만, 그녀는 의리가 있었어요.
translit: geuneun uiliga eobs-eossjiman, geunyeoneun uiliga iss-eoss-eoyo.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
I’ll get it – I got it.
translate: 저는 그걸 가질 거예요 – 저는 그걸 가졌어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol gajil geoyeyo – jeoneun geugeol gajyeoss-eoyo.

text: I’ll bring that – I brought that.
translate: 저는 그걸 가지고 올 거예요 – 저는 그걸 가지고 왔어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol gajigo ol geoyeyo – jeoneun geugeol gajigo wass-eoyo.

text: I’ll buy that – I bought that.
translate: 저는 그걸 살 거예요 – 저는 그걸 샀어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol sal geoyeyo – jeoneun geugeol sass-eoyo.

text: I expect that – I expected that.
translate: 저는 그걸 기대해요 – 저는 그걸 기대했어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol gidaehaeyo – jeoneun geugeol gidaehaess-eoyo.

text: I’ll explain that – I explained that.
translate: 저는 그걸 설명할 거예요 – 저는 그걸 설명했어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol seolmyeonghal geoyeyo – jeoneun geugeol seolmyeonghaess-eoyo.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: 저는 그걸 알아요 – 저는 그걸 알았어요.
translit: jeoneun geugeol al-ayo – jeoneun geugeol al-ass-eoyo.

text: I am not staying because I still have to work.
translate: 저는 아직 일해야 해서 머무르지 않아요.
translit: jeoneun ajig ilhaeya haeseo meomuleuji anh-ayo.

text: He was poor, but she was rich.
He had no money, only debts.
He had no luck, only bad luck.
I’m going because it is already late.
He had no success, only failure.
He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
He was not happy, but sad.
He was not friendly, but unfriendly.
My son did not want to play with the doll.
translate: 제 아들은 인형놀이를 하고 싶지 않았어요.
translit: je adeul-eun inhyeongnol-ileul hago sipji anh-ass-eoyo.

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
translate: 제 딸은 축구를 하고 싶지 않았어요.
translit: je ttal-eun chugguleul hago sipji anh-ass-eoyo.

text: My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: 제 아내는 저와 체스를 하고 싶지 않았어요.
translit: je anaeneun jeowa cheseuleul hago sipji anh-ass-eoyo.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.
They did not want to tidy the room.
They did not want to go to bed.
He was not allowed to eat ice cream.
He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
He was not allowed to eat sweets.
I was allowed to make a wish.
I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
I was allowed to take a chocolate.
Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?
During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
translate: 휴일 동안 아이들은 밖에 오래 있어도 됐어요.
translit: hyuil dong-an aideul-eun bakk-e olae iss-eodo dwaess-eoyo.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
They were allowed to stay up late.
You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
translate: 당신은 너무 게을러요 – 너무 게으르지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun neomu geeulleoyo – neomu geeuleuji maseyo!

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
translate: 당신은 너무 많이 자요 – 너무 늦게까지 자지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun neomu manh-i jayo – neomu neujgekkaji jaji maseyo!

text: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: 당신은 집에 너무 늦게 와요 – 집에 너무 늦게 오지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun jib-e neomu neujge wayo – jib-e neomu neujge oji maseyo!

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: 당신은 너무 크게 웃어요 – 너무 크게 웃지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun neomu keuge us-eoyo – neomu keuge usji maseyo!

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
translate: 당신은 너무 작게 말해요 – 너무 작게 말하지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun neomu jagge malhaeyo – neomu jagge malhaji maseyo!

text: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
translate: 당신은 너무 많이 마셔요 – 너무 많이 마시지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun neomu manh-i masyeoyo – neomu manh-i masiji maseyo!

text: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
translate: 당신은 담배를 너무 많이 피워요 – 너무 많이 담배를 피우지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun dambaeleul neomu manh-i piwoyo – neomu manh-i dambaeleul piuji maseyo!

text: You work too much – don’t work so much!
translate: 당신은 일을 너무 많이 해요 – 너무 많이 일하지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun il-eul neomu manh-i haeyo – neomu manh-i ilhaji maseyo!

text: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: 당신은 운전을 너무 빨리 해요 – 너무 빨리 운전하지 마세요!
translit: dangsin-eun unjeon-eul neomu ppalli haeyo – neomu ppalli unjeonhaji maseyo!

text: How did you pass the exam?
How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
What did you come to know?
I am wearing a blue dress.
I am wearing a red dress.
I am wearing a green dress.
An old lady lives at the top.
A fat lady lives at the top.
But the neighbours have naughty children.
I was talking on the phone all the time.
Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
I hope that it gets better.
Do you know that for sure?
I think that it is old.
The boss definitely has a girlfriend.
It is very possible that he has a girlfriend.
translate: 그에게 여자친구가 있다는 것은 아주 가능성이 높아요.
translit: geuege yeojachinguga issdaneun geos-eun aju ganeungseong-i nop-ayo.

text: We had to water the flowers.
We had to clean the apartment.
We had to wash the dishes.
Did you have to pay the bill?
Did you have to pay an entrance fee?
Did you have to pay a fine?
Who had to go home early?
Who had to take the train?
We did not want to stay long.
We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.
I thought you wanted to call your wife.
translate: 저는 당신이 당신 아내에게 전화하고 싶은 줄 알았어요.
translit: jeoneun dangsin-i dangsin anaeege jeonhwahago sip-eun jul al-ass-eoyo.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.
translate: 저는 당신이 안내소에 전화하고 싶은 줄 알았어요.
translit: jeoneun dangsin-i annaeso-e jeonhwahago sip-eun jul al-ass-eoyo.

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.
translate: 저는 당신이 피자를 주문하고 싶은 줄 알았어요.
translit: jeoneun dangsin-i pijaleul jumunhago sip-eun jul al-ass-eoyo.

text: Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?
I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
translate: 당신이 맥주를 너무 많이 마셔서 화가 나요.
translit: dangsin-i maegjuleul neomu manh-i masyeoseo hwaga nayo.

text: I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: 당신이 너무 늦게 와서 화가 나요.
translit: dangsin-i neomu neujge waseo hwaga nayo.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
I think he is sleeping now.
translate: 그는 지금 자고 있는 것 같아요.
translit: geuneun jigeum jago issneun geos gat-ayo.

text: We hope that he marries our daughter.
We hope that he has a lot of money.
We hope that he is a millionaire.
I heard that your wife had an accident.
I heard that she is in the hospital.
I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
I’m happy that you are interested.
I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
translate: 당신이 그 집을 사고 싶어해서 기뻐요.
translit: dangsin-i geu jib-eul sago sip-eohaeseo gippeoyo.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
I’m afraid I have no more money.
translate: 저는 돈이 더 이상 없는 것 같아요.
translit: jeoneun don-i deo isang eobsneun geos gat-ayo.

text: Since when is she no longer working?
Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: 네, 그녀는 결혼한 후부터 더이상 일을 안 해요.
translit: ne, geunyeoneun gyeolhonhan hubuteo deoisang il-eul an haeyo.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: 그녀는 결혼한 후부터, 더이상 일을 안 해요.
translit: geunyeoneun gyeolhonhan hubuteo, deoisang il-eul an haeyo.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: 그들은 아이들이 생긴 후부터, 외출을 잘 안해요.
translit: geudeul-eun aideul-i saeng-gin hubuteo, oechul-eul jal anhaeyo.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
She listens to music while she does her work.
I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: 저는 안경이 없으면 아무 것도 못 봐요.
translit: jeoneun angyeong-i eobs-eumyeon amu geosdo mos bwayo.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: 저는 음악이 너무 시끄러우면 아무 것도 못 이해해요.
translit: jeoneun eum-ag-i neomu sikkeuleoumyeon amu geosdo mos ihaehaeyo.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: 저는 감기가 걸리면 아무 냄새도 못 맡아요.
translit: jeoneun gamgiga geollimyeon amu naemsaedo mos mat-ayo.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: 우리는 비가 오면 택시를 잡을 거예요.
translit: ulineun biga omyeon taegsileul jab-eul geoyeyo.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: 우리는 복권에 당첨되면 세계일주 여행을 할 거예요.
translit: ulineun boggwon-e dangcheomdoemyeon segyeilju yeohaeng-eul hal geoyeyo.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: 우리는 그가 곧 오지 않으면 식사를 시작할 거예요.
translit: ulineun geuga god oji anh-eumyeon sigsaleul sijaghal geoyeyo.

text: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
translate: 저는 제 머리카락이 마를 때까지 기다릴 거예요.
translit: jeoneun je meolikalag-i maleul ttaekkaji gidalil geoyeyo.

text: I’ll wait until the film is over.
translate: 저는 영화가 끝날 때까지 기다릴 거예요.
translit: jeoneun yeonghwaga kkeutnal ttaekkaji gidalil geoyeyo.

text: I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
translate: 저는 신호등이 초록색일 때까지 기다릴 거예요.
translit: jeoneun sinhodeung-i chologsaeg-il ttaekkaji gidalil geoyeyo.

text: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
Repair the roof before the winter begins.
Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
Close the window before you go out.
Yes, after the class is over.
After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: 그는 사고가 난 후에, 더 이상 일을 할 수 없었어요.
translit: geuneun sagoga nan hue, deo isang il-eul hal su eobs-eoss-eoyo.

text: After he had lost his job, he went to America.
translate: 그는 일자리를 잃은 후에, 미국에 갔어요.
translit: geuneun iljalileul ilh-eun hue, migug-e gass-eoyo.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
translate: 그는 미국에 간 후에, 부자가 됐어요.
translit: geuneun migug-e gan hue, bujaga dwaess-eoyo.

text: Have you already been to Berlin?
No, I don’t know anyone here.
translate: 아니요, 저는 여기에 있는 아무도 몰라요.
translit: aniyo, jeoneun yeogie issneun amudo mollayo.

text: a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: 아니요, 여기에 더 이상 안 머물 거예요.
translit: aniyo, yeogie deo isang an meomul geoyeyo.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.
translate: 아니요, 저는 아무 것도 안 마시고 싶어요.
translit: aniyo, jeoneun amu geosdo an masigo sip-eoyo.

text: No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
translate: 아니요, 아직 아무 것도 안 먹었어요.
translit: aniyo, ajig amu geosdo an meog-eoss-eoyo.

text: Does anyone else want a coffee?
He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: 그는 티비가 켜져 있었는데도 잠이 들었어요.
translit: geuneun tibiga kyeojyeo iss-eossneundedo jam-i deul-eoss-eoyo.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: 티비가 켜져 있었어요. 그런데도 그는 잠이 들었어요.
translit: tibiga kyeojyeo iss-eoss-eoyo. geuleondedo geuneun jam-i deul-eoss-eoyo.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: 이미 많이 늦었어요. 그런데도, 그는 한참을 머물렀어요.
translit: imi manh-i neuj-eoss-eoyo. geuleondedo, geuneun hancham-eul meomulleoss-eoyo.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: 우리는 약속이 있었어요. 그런데도, 그는 안 왔어요.
translit: ulineun yagsog-i iss-eoss-eoyo. geuleondedo, geuneun an wass-eoyo.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: 거리가 미끄러운데도 그는 너무 빨리 운전을 해요.
translit: geoliga mikkeuleoundedo geuneun neomu ppalli unjeon-eul haeyo.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: 면허증이 없는데도 불구하고, 그는 운전을 해요.
translit: myeonheojeung-i eobsneundedo bulguhago, geuneun unjeon-eul haeyo.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: 찻길이 미끄러운데도 불구하고, 그는 빨리 운전을 해요.
translit: chasgil-i mikkeuleoundedo bulguhago, geuneun ppalli unjeon-eul haeyo.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: 술이 취했는데도 불구하고, 그는 자전거를 타요.
translit: sul-i chwihaessneundedo bulguhago, geuneun jajeongeoleul tayo.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: 그녀는 대학을 다녔는데도, 일자리를 못 구해요.
translit: geunyeoneun daehag-eul danyeossneundedo, iljalileul mos guhaeyo.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: 그녀는 통증이 있는데도, 병원에 안 가요.
translit: geunyeoneun tongjeung-i issneundedo, byeong-won-e an gayo.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: 그녀는 대학을 다녔어요. 그럼에도 불구하고, 그녀는 일자리를 못 구해요.
translit: geunyeoneun daehag-eul danyeoss-eoyo. geuleom-edo bulguhago, geunyeoneun iljalileul mos guhaeyo.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: 그녀는 통증이 있어요. 그럼에도 불구하고, 그녀는 병원에 안 가요.
translit: geunyeoneun tongjeung-i iss-eoyo. geuleom-edo bulguhago, geunyeoneun byeong-won-e an gayo.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: 그녀는 돈이 없어요. 그럼에도 불구하고, 그녀는 차를 사요.
translit: geunyeoneun don-i eobs-eoyo. geuleom-edo bulguhago, geunyeoneun chaleul sayo.

text: I don’t know if he loves me.
I don’t know if he’ll come back.
I don’t know if he’ll call me.

translate: 어쩌면 그가 저를 사랑 안 할까요?
translit: eojjeomyeon geuga jeoleul salang an halkkayo?

translate: 어쩌면 그가 저에게 전화를 안 할까요?
translit: eojjeomyeon geuga jeoege jeonhwaleul an halkkayo?

text: I wonder if he thinks about me.
I wonder if he has someone else.
Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
translate: 그가 저를 정말 좋아하는 것 같지 않아요.
translit: geuga jeoleul jeongmal joh-ahaneun geos gatji anh-ayo.

text: I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
translate: 그가 저에게 편지를 쓸 것 같지 않아요.
translit: geuga jeoege pyeonjileul sseul geos gatji anh-ayo.

text: I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
translate: 그가 저와 결혼할 것 같지 않아요.
translit: geuga jeowa gyeolhonhal geos gatji anh-ayo.

text: The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.
How do I get to her parents’ house?
The house is at the end of the road.
translate: 그 집은 그 길의 끝에 있어요.
translit: geu jib-eun geu gil-ui kkeut-e iss-eoyo.

text: What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
What are the doctor’s consultation times?
What time is the museum open?
The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
The train was on time, but too full.
translate: 그 기차는 정각에 왔지만, 너무 꽉 찼어요.
translit: geu gichaneun jeong-gag-e wassjiman, neomu kkwag chass-eoyo.

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
He’ll take either the bus or the train.
He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: 그는 오늘 저녁이나 내일 아침에 올 거예요.
translit: geuneun oneul jeonyeog-ina naeil achim-e ol geoyeyo.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: 그는 우리 집이나 호텔에 머물 거예요.
translit: geuneun uli jib-ina hotel-e meomul geoyeyo.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
She knows Spain as well as England.
He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: 그녀는 독어를 할뿐만 아니라 불어도 해요.
translit: geunyeoneun dog-eoleul halppunman anila bul-eodo haeyo.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: 저는 피아노뿐만 아니라 기타도 못 쳐요.
translit: jeoneun pianoppunman anila gitado mos chyeoyo.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: 저는 왈츠뿐만 아니라 삼바도 못 춰요.
translit: jeoneun walcheuppunman anila sambado mos chwoyo.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: 저는 오페라뿐만 아니라 발레도 안 좋아해요.
translit: jeoneun opelappunman anila balledo an joh-ahaeyo.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: 당신은 더 빨리 일할수록 더 빨리 끝낼 거예요.
translit: dangsin-eun deo ppalli ilhalsulog deo ppalli kkeutnael geoyeyo.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: 당신은 더 빨리 올수록 더 빨리 갈 거예요.
translit: dangsin-eun deo ppalli olsulog deo ppalli gal geoyeyo.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: 사람은 더 나이가 들수록, 더 편안해져요.
translit: salam-eun deo naiga deulsulog, deo pyeon-anhaejyeoyo.

text: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
I become tired as soon as I have to study.
I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: 저는 예순 살이 되자마자 일을 그만둘 거예요.
translit: jeoneun yesun sal-i doejamaja il-eul geumandul geoyeyo.

text: As soon as I have a moment.
He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
I’ll work as long as I can.
translate: 저는 일할 수 있는 한 일할 거예요.
translit: jeoneun ilhal su issneun han ilhal geoyeyo.

text: I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: 저는 건강이 허락하는 한 일할 거예요.
translit: jeoneun geongang-i heolaghaneun han ilhal geoyeyo.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: 그는 일하는 대신에 침대에 누워 있어요.
translit: geuneun ilhaneun daesin-e chimdaee nuwo iss-eoyo.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: 그녀는 요리하는 대신에 신문을 읽고 있어요.
translit: geunyeoneun yolihaneun daesin-e sinmun-eul ilg-go iss-eoyo.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: 그는 집에 가는 대신에 술집에 있어요.
translit: geuneun jib-e ganeun daesin-e suljib-e iss-eoyo.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
translate: 제가 아는 바로는, 그는 여기 살아요.
translit: jega aneun baloneun, geuneun yeogi sal-ayo.

text: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: 제가 아는 바로는, 그의 아내는 아파요.
translit: jega aneun baloneun, geuui anaeneun apayo.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: 저는 늦잠을 잤어요; 안 그랬다면 제 시간에 왔을 거예요.
translit: jeoneun neuj-jam-eul jass-eoyo; an geulaessdamyeon je sigan-e wass-eul geoyeyo.

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: 저는 버스를 놓쳤어요; 안 그랬다면 제 시간에 왔을 거예요.
translit: jeoneun beoseuleul nohchyeoss-eoyo; an geulaessdamyeon je sigan-e wass-eul geoyeyo.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: 저는 길을 잃었어요; 안 그랬다면 제 시간에 왔을 거예요.
translit: jeoneun gil-eul ilh-eoss-eoyo; an geulaessdamyeon je sigan-e wass-eul geoyeyo.

text: No, it costs only one hundred Euros.
Do you want some more soup?
But I already know a lot of people.
But I will be back on Sunday.
But she already has a boyfriend.
